definition: to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: The essence of French savoir-vivre is simplicity.
sentences.chinese: 法国人的处世之道的实质就是淳朴。

sentences.english: “But you know both God and how he works, ” Jesus says.
sentences.chinese: “但是你既知道也知道他的处世之道，”耶稣说。

sentences.english: It is not only the best as a matter of priciple , but it is the path of peace and honor.
sentences.chinese: 这不仅是最好的处世之道，更能给带来和睦和尊重。

sentences.english: I also got from them a moral code, and a sense of what it takes to live in a free society.
sentences.chinese: 我也继承了他们的道德准则和自由社会的处世之道。

sentences.english: Jesus says worry is characteristic of people who don't know God and the way he works.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣说忧虑是不懂上帝和上帝的处世之道的人的性格。

sentences.english: He's too young to understand the ways of the world.
sentences.chinese: 他还太年轻，不懂得处世之道。

definition: to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
the way of one's conduct and interaction in society (idiom)
doctrine of the mean/moderation in all things
worldly wisdom/the ways of the world/to know how to get on in the world
to conduct oneself/to behave with integrity
kindhearted and moderate (idiom); temperate and gentle
What you don't want done to you, don't do to others. (idiom, from the Confucian analects)/Do as you would be done by./Do not do to others what you would not have them do to you.
pinyin: ji3 suo3 bu4 yu4 , wu4 shi1 yu2 ren2

definition: a wise man looks after his own hide (idiom)/to put one's own safety before matters of principle
